trajectory: Became part of MedAssets-Precyse → rebranded nThrive (2016) → FinThrive (2022).
Steady growth; bigger AI/commerce push; hit record users in 2025.
status: Public (NYSE: PINS); 578M MAUs, +17% rev in Q2'25.

trajectory: A9 brand retired; folded into Amazon Search; a9.com taken down in 2019.
status: Functions as Amazon Search inside Amazon.

trajectory: Pandemic trough → recovery; exploring separation of Viator/TheFork in 2025.
status: Public; owns Viator & TheFork, evaluating separation.

trajectory: Boutique tech recruiting firm (not a product company).
Acquired by Sitecore in 2021.
Killed the $20B Figma deal (Dec 2023); leaned harder into Firefly/AI.
Taken private by Thoma Bravo (2021).
Acquired by McAfee (2018); relaunched as Skyhigh Security under STG (2022).
Continued steady, review-driven ad business through 2025.
Deep restructuring; 'comeback' narrative in 2024–25.
Acquired by Seismic (2018).
Major layoffs in 2023 & 2024; in 2025 Recruit starts integrating Indeed & Glassdoor.
status: Part of Recruit's HR Tech unit; deeper Glassdoor tie-up.

trajectory: Acquisition by Google closed Jan 2021.
IPO 2019; reached sustained GAAP profitability by 2024.
Stayed private; multiple restructurings/layoffs in 2023–24.
Kept compounding as an IT solutions VAR; strong FY25 prints.
Acquired by Germany's Parship/Elite Group (2018).
Continued as a telco-focused analytics company.
Already part of AOL (pre-2017); AOL/Yahoo sold to Apollo in 2021.
status: Within Yahoo's ad-tech history; brand long sunset.

trajectory: Acquired by Enova (2020).
Rebranded to Meta (2021).
Sold Watson Health → Merative (2022); launched watsonx (2023).
Launched AI platform Poe (public in 2023; API 2025).
IPO in 2020; profitable at scale by 2023–24.
Acquired by Elon Musk (Oct 2022); rebranded to X; HQ moved to TX (2024).
IPO in 2021 (NYSE: COUR).
Acquired by Recruit (2018); 2025 integration moves with Indeed.
status: Under Recruit's HR Tech; tighter Indeed pairing.

trajectory: Acquired Exponea (2021) + $150M raise.
Wound down iBuying (2021) then refocused; Q2'25 beat.
status: Public (Z, ZG); profitable adj. EBITDA in Q2'25.

trajectory: Bought by WeWork (2017), sold to AlleyCorp-led group (2020).
Leadership turmoil 2022; pivoted to gen-AI suite in 2024.
Verizon sold Yahoo/AOL to Apollo; now inside Yahoo (2021).
UBS–Wealthfront acquisition terminated (Sept 2022); stayed independent.
Direct-listed on NYSE in 2020; scaled gov/commercial AI.
Acquired by Contentsquare (deal closed Dec 2023).
Announced 'Apple Intelligence' (WWDC 2024) with a big Siri upgrade; expanded 2025.
Pinterest acquired Kosei (2015) for ML recommendations.
Bought by Sizmek (2017); Amazon acquired Sizmek's ad server/DCO in 2019.
status: Rocket Fuel brand gone; pieces live inside Amazon Advertising & others.

trajectory: Continued as Alphabet; search/ads + cloud + devices expansion.
CVS Health completed acquisition (Nov 2018).
Acquired by Zillow (2015); brand kept within Zillow Group.
Same Apple trajectory as above.
Steady financials, brand strength through 2025.
Taken private by Siris/Evergreen (deal closed 2019).
Ongoing DOE/NNSA mission; run by NTESS (Honeywell subsidiary).

status: Active, recently secured $15 million in seed funding.
trajectory: Growing, focused on democratizing social media video creation with its AI-powered platform, Diffuse, and expanding its market reach.

status: Active, venture capital-backed. The company raised $25.1 million in a Series A round in March 2025, bringing its total funding to $29.4 million.
trajectory: Inductive Bio is focused on accelerating small molecule drug discovery using AI and machine learning, with a goal to expand its AI model R&D and grow its data consortium.

status: Active, venture capital-backed. The company recently raised a $210 million Series B round in July 2025, valuing the company at $3.5 billion.
trajectory: OpenEvidence is expanding its AI-powered medical search and decision tools, with plans to further strategic content partnerships and scale its clinical research tools. The company achieved $50 million in annualized revenue as of June 2025.

status: Actively expanding its enterprise AI solutions with recent executive hires and an acquisition, having recently closed a significant funding round.
trajectory: Rapidly growing in the enterprise AI market, Cohere raised $500 million in August 2025, increasing its valuation to $6.8 billion, and focuses on secure, customizable AI models for businesses and governments.

status: A leading organization in the AI sector, actively developing and deploying advanced AI models such as GPT, DALL-E, and Sora.
trajectory: Experiencing rapid growth and expansion, OpenAI secured $40 billion in Series F funding in March 2025, reaching a $300 billion valuation, and has made several strategic acquisitions including io for $6.5 billion.

status: Elad Gil is a prominent entrepreneur, active investor, and advisor in the technology and startup sectors. He co-founded Color Health and Mixer Labs (acquired by Twitter), and manages Gil Capital, a significant venture fund.
trajectory: His career trajectory includes leadership roles at Google (starting the mobile team) and Twitter (VP of Corporate Strategy), evolving into a highly influential solo venture capitalist who has made early investments in over 30 unicorn startups.

status: Active, operating as a leading AI interpretability research company focused on understanding and designing advanced AI systems.
trajectory: Experiencing rapid growth, having raised a $7 million seed round in August 2024 and a $50 million Series A round in April 2025 at a $200 million valuation to further develop its Ember platform and research initiatives.
Recently secured a Series K funding round, pushing its valuation to over $100 billion, with plans for further AI product development and acquisitions.

status: Actively operating and developing drugs using an AI-powered platform.
trajectory: Closed a $372 million Series D funding round in June 2024, with a valuation described as a "material step up" from its $1 billion valuation in September 2021.
